statement: Saw II sold over 3 million units.
explanation_human: Saw II sold over 3 million units, however it does not say whether it sold them on DVD.
explanation_model: The claim is that Saw II sold over 3 million units. The evidence says that Saw II was released to DVD and topped charts its first week, selling more than 3 million units. So we can infer that the claim is true.
label: SUPPORTS

statement: Matthew Gray Gubler is not an actor.
explanation_human: Matthew Gray Gubler is an actor.
explanation_model: The claim is that Matthew Gray Gubler is not an actor. The evidence says that he is an American actor. So, the claim is false.
label: REFUTES

statement: Azithromycin is sold under different trade names.
explanation_human: "The relevant information about the claim is lacking in the context."
explanation_model: The first sentence is the claim and the second sentence is the evidence. The evidence is saying "It is available as a generic medication and is sold under many trade names worldwide." The word "and" is joining two ideas together, so we can split the evidence into two parts. Part A is "It is available as a generic medication." Part B is "It is sold under many trade names worldwide." We can see that Part A is true because the medication is available as a generic. Part B is also true because it is sold under many trade names worldwide. Therefore, the entire claim is true.
label: SUPPORTS
